segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 8
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 8

segments.pli: 7. Bhūmicālavagga
segments.en: 7. Earthquakes

segments.pli: 64. Gayāsīsasutta
segments.en: 64. At Gāyā Head

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā gayāyaṃ viharati gayāsīse.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Gāyā on Gāyā Head.

segments.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi … pe …
segments.en: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

segments.pli: “pubbāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sambodhā anabhisambuddho bodhisattova samāno obhāsaññeva kho sañjānāmi, no ca rūpāni passāmi. (1)
segments.en: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still not awake but intent on awakening—I perceived light but did not see visions.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etadahosi:
segments.en: Then it occurred to me,

segments.pli: ‘sace kho ahaṃ obhāsañceva sañjāneyyaṃ rūpāni ca passeyyaṃ;
segments.en: ‘What if I were to both perceive light and see visions?

segments.pli: evaṃ me idaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ parisuddhataraṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: Then my knowledge and vision would become even more purified.’

segments.pli: So kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, aparena samayena appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto obhāsañceva sañjānāmi, rūpāni ca passāmi;
segments.en: So after some time, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, I perceived light and saw visions.

segments.pli: no ca kho tāhi devatāhi saddhiṃ santiṭṭhāmi sallapāmi sākacchaṃ samāpajjāmi. (2)
segments.en: But I didn’t associate with those deities, converse, or engage in discussion.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etadahosi:
segments.en: Then it occurred to me,

segments.pli: ‘sace kho ahaṃ obhāsañceva sañjāneyyaṃ, rūpāni ca passeyyaṃ, tāhi ca devatāhi saddhiṃ santiṭṭheyyaṃ sallapeyyaṃ sākacchaṃ samāpajjeyyaṃ;
segments.en: ‘What if I were to perceive light and see visions; and associate with those deities, converse, and engage in discussion?

segments.pli: evaṃ me idaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ parisuddhataraṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: Then my knowledge and vision would become even more purified.’

segments.pli: So kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, aparena samayena appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto obhāsañceva sañjānāmi, rūpāni ca passāmi, tāhi ca devatāhi saddhiṃ santiṭṭhāmi sallapāmi sākacchaṃ samāpajjāmi;
segments.en: So after some time … I perceived light and saw visions. And I associated with those deities, conversed, and engaged in discussion.

segments.pli: no ca kho tā devatā jānāmi—
segments.en: But I didn’t know which

segments.pli: imā devatā amukamhā vā amukamhā vā devanikāyāti. (3)
segments.en: orders of gods those deities came from.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etadahosi:
segments.en: Then it occurred to me,

segments.pli: ‘sace kho ahaṃ obhāsañceva sañjāneyyaṃ, rūpāni ca passeyyaṃ, tāhi ca devatāhi saddhiṃ santiṭṭheyyaṃ sallapeyyaṃ sākacchaṃ samāpajjeyyaṃ, tā ca devatā jāneyyaṃ:
segments.en: ‘What if I were to perceive light and see visions; and associate with those deities, converse, and engage in discussion;

segments.pli: “imā devatā amukamhā vā amukamhā vā devanikāyā”ti;
segments.en: and find out which orders of gods those deities come from?

segments.pli: evaṃ me idaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ parisuddhataraṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: Then my knowledge and vision would become even more purified.’

segments.pli: So kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, aparena samayena appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto obhāsañceva sañjānāmi, rūpāni ca passāmi, tāhi ca devatāhi saddhiṃ santiṭṭhāmi sallapāmi sākacchaṃ samāpajjāmi, tā ca devatā jānāmi:
segments.en: So after some time … I perceived light and saw visions. And I associated with those deities … And I found out which orders of gods those deities came from.

segments.pli: ‘imā devatā amukamhā vā amukamhā vā devanikāyā’ti;
no ca kho tā devatā jānāmi:
segments.en: But I didn’t know what

segments.pli: ‘imā devatā imassa kammassa vipākena ito cutā tattha upapannā’ti … pe …
segments.en: deeds caused those deities to be reborn there after passing away from here.

segments.pli: tā ca devatā jānāmi:
segments.en: So after some time … I found out what

segments.pli: ‘imā devatā imassa kammassa vipākena ito cutā tattha upapannā’ti;
segments.en: deeds caused those deities to be reborn there after passing away from here.

segments.pli: no ca kho tā devatā jānāmi:
segments.en: But I didn’t know what

segments.pli: ‘imā devatā imassa kammassa vipākena evamāhārā evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvediniyo’ti … pe …
segments.en: deeds caused those deities to have such food and such an experience of pleasure and pain.

segments.pli: tā ca devatā jānāmi:
segments.en: So after some time … I found out what

segments.pli: ‘imā devatā imassa kammassa vipākena evamāhārā evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvediniyo’ti;
segments.en: deeds caused those deities to have such food and such an experience of pleasure and pain.

segments.pli: no ca kho tā devatā jānāmi:
segments.en: But I didn’t know that

segments.pli: ‘imā devatā evaṃdīghāyukā evaṃciraṭṭhitikā’ti … pe …
segments.en: these deities have a life-span of such a length.

segments.pli: tā ca devatā jānāmi:
segments.en: So after some time … I found out that

segments.pli: ‘imā devatā evaṃdīghāyukā evaṃciraṭṭhitikā’ti;
segments.en: these deities have a life-span of such a length.

segments.pli: no ca kho tā devatā jānāmi yadi vā me imāhi devatāhi saddhiṃ sannivutthapubbaṃ yadi vā na sannivutthapubbanti. (4–7.)
segments.en: But I didn’t know whether or not I had previously lived together with those deities.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etadahosi:
segments.en: Then it occurred to me,

segments.pli: ‘sace kho ahaṃ obhāsañceva sañjāneyyaṃ, rūpāni ca passeyyaṃ, tāhi ca devatāhi saddhiṃ santiṭṭheyyaṃ sallapeyyaṃ sākacchaṃ samāpajjeyyaṃ, tā ca devatā jāneyyaṃ:
segments.en: ‘What if I were to perceive light and see visions; and associate with those deities, converse, and engage in discussion;

segments.pli: “imā devatā amukamhā vā amukamhā vā devanikāyā”ti, tā ca devatā jāneyyaṃ:
segments.en: and find out which orders of gods those deities come from;

segments.pli: “imā devatā imassa kammassa vipākena ito cutā tattha upapannā”ti, tā ca devatā jāneyyaṃ:
segments.en: and what deeds caused those deities to be reborn there after passing away from here;

segments.pli: “imā devatā evamāhārā evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvediniyo”ti, tā ca devatā jāneyyaṃ:
segments.en: and what deeds caused those deities to have such food and such an experience of pleasure and pain;

segments.pli: “imā devatā evaṃdīghāyukā evaṃciraṭṭhitikā”ti, tā ca devatā jāneyyaṃ yadi vā me imāhi devatāhi saddhiṃ sannivutthapubbaṃ yadi vā na sannivutthapubbanti;
segments.en: and that these deities have a life-span of such a length; and whether or not I have previously lived together with those deities.

segments.pli: evaṃ me idaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ parisuddhataraṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: Then my knowledge and vision would become even more purified.’

segments.pli: So kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, aparena samayena appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto obhāsañceva sañjānāmi, rūpāni ca passāmi, tāhi ca devatāhi saddhiṃ santiṭṭhāmi sallapāmi sākacchaṃ samāpajjāmi, tā ca devatā jānāmi:
segments.en: So after some time …

segments.pli: ‘imā devatā amukamhā vā amukamhā vā devanikāyā’ti, tā ca devatā jānāmi:
‘imā devatā imassa kammassa vipākena ito cutā tattha upapannā’ti, tā ca devatā jānāmi:
‘imā devatā evamāhārā evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvediniyo’ti, tā ca devatā jānāmi:
‘imā devatā evaṃdīghāyukā evaṃciraṭṭhitikā’ti, tā ca devatā jānāmi yadi vā me devatāhi saddhiṃ sannivutthapubbaṃ yadi vā na sannivutthapubbanti. (8)
segments.en: I found out whether or not I have previously lived together with those deities.

segments.pli: Yāvakīvañca me, bhikkhave, evaṃ aṭṭhaparivaṭṭaṃ adhidevañāṇadassanaṃ na suvisuddhaṃ ahosi, neva tāvāhaṃ, bhikkhave, ‘sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho’ti paccaññāsiṃ.
segments.en: As long as my knowledge and vision about the deities was not fully purified from these eight perspectives, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.

segments.pli: Yato ca kho me, bhikkhave, evaṃ aṭṭhaparivaṭṭaṃ adhidevañāṇadassanaṃ suvisuddhaṃ ahosi, athāhaṃ, bhikkhave, ‘sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho’ti paccaññāsiṃ;
segments.en: But when my knowledge and vision about the deities was fully purified from these eight perspectives, I announced my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.

segments.pli: ñāṇañca pana me dassanaṃ udapādi;
segments.en: Knowledge and vision arose in me:

segments.pli: akuppā me cetovimutti; ayamantimā jāti natthi dāni punabbhavo”ti.
segments.en: ‘My freedom is unshakable; this is my last rebirth; now there are no more future lives.’”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Gāyā…

suttaplex.blurb: At Gayā, the Buddha describes his meditation before awakening. He was able to see lights and forms, converse with gods, and understand the deeds that made them gods.
